availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Trigg County, Kentucky, merchant. Virginia native. Married to Cornelia Thompson Burke in Trigg County, Kentucky, on November 25, 1858. Father of Bettie J. Burke. Merchant in Essex County, Virginia, in 1850. Household owned five enslaved persons in Essex County in 1850. Merchant in Trigg County, Kentucky, in 1860. Owned four enslaved persons in Trigg County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Virginia, Essex County, p. 85B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Virginia, Essex County, p. 497.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Trigg County, Cadiz, p. 187.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Trigg County, Cadiz, p. 391A.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Trigg County, Cadiz, p. 52B.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll 994056, Trigg County Marriages.
"Robert Burke (1831-1892)," Find A Grave, Memorial 94787534, accessed April 17, 2023, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/94787534.
